00032      struct StringWithLineNumber
00033         {
00034           std::string str;      // DQ (1/23/2010): this name is difficult to trace within the code.
00035           std::string filename; // Empty string means generated code
00036           unsigned int line;
00037 
00038           StringWithLineNumber(const std::string& str, const std::string& filename, unsigned int line): str(str), filename(filename), line(line) {}
00039 
00040           std::string toString() const;
00041         };
00042 
00043 #ifndef USE_ROSE
00044      typedef std::vector<StringWithLineNumber> FileWithLineNumbers;
00045 #else
00046   // workaround of bug 315, separating definitions for a namespace
00047   // Liao, 2/16/2009
00048    }
00049 
00050 namespace StringUtility
00051    {
00052      typedef std::vector<StringUtility::StringWithLineNumber> FileWithLineNumbers;
00053 #endif
00054 
00055          inline std::ostream& operator<<(std::ostream& os, const StringWithLineNumber& s) {
00056            os << s.toString();
00057            return os;
00058          }
00059 
00060          std::string toString(const FileWithLineNumbers& strings, const std::string& filename = "<unknown>", int line = 1);
00061 
00062          inline FileWithLineNumbers& operator+=(FileWithLineNumbers& a, const FileWithLineNumbers& b) {
00063            a.insert(a.end(), b.begin(), b.end());
00064            return a;
00065          }
00066 
00067          inline FileWithLineNumbers operator+(const FileWithLineNumbers& a, const FileWithLineNumbers& b) {
00068            FileWithLineNumbers f = a;
00069            f += b;
00070            return f;
00071          }
00072 
00073 #if 0
00074          inline std::ostream& operator<<(std::ostream& os, const FileWithLineNumbers& f) {
00075            os << StringUtility::toString(f);
00076            return os;
00077          }
00078 #endif
00079 
00080          inline FileWithLineNumbers& operator<<(FileWithLineNumbers& f, const std::string& str) {
00081            // Add loose text to the output file
00082            if (!f.empty() && f.back().filename == "") {
00083              f.back().str += str;
00084            } else {
00085              f.push_back(StringWithLineNumber(str, "", 1));
00086            }
00087            return f;
00088          }
00089 
00090          inline FileWithLineNumbers& operator<<(FileWithLineNumbers& f, const char* str) {
00091            f << std::string(str);
00092            return f;
00093          }

00264            /* Files can be classified as being in one of three
00265             * locations: We don't know if it's user or system It is a
00266             * user (application) file It is a system library This file
00267             * does not exist */
00268            enum FileNameLocation 
00269                                { 
00270                                                            FILENAME_LOCATION_UNKNOWN, 
00271                                    FILENAME_LOCATION_USER,    
00272                                    FILENAME_LOCATION_LIBRARY,
00273                                    FILENAME_LOCATION_NOT_EXIST };
00274            
00275            /* Files can be classified as being part of one of these
00276             * libraries: Unknown, it isn't a library - it's part of
00277             * the user application, or any of the libraries that the
00278             * enum values imply, this list will likely be added to
00279             * over time */
00280            /* 
00281            enum FileNameLibrary { FILENAME_LIBRARY_UNKNOWN,
00282                                   FILENAME_LIBRARY_USER,
00283                                   FILENAME_LIBRARY_C,
00284                                   FILENAME_LIBRARY_STDCXX,
00285                                   FILENAME_LIBRARY_STL,
00286                                   FILENAME_LIBRARY_LINUX,
00287                                   FILENAME_LIBRARY_GCC,
00288                                   FILENAME_LIBRARY_BOOST,
00289                                   FILENAME_LIBRARY_ROSE };
00290                                   */
00291 
00292            static const std::string FILENAME_LIBRARY_UNKNOWN = "Unknown";
00293            static const std::string FILENAME_LIBRARY_USER = "User";
00294            static const std::string FILENAME_LIBRARY_C = "C";
00295            static const std::string FILENAME_LIBRARY_STDCXX = "C++";
00296            static const std::string FILENAME_LIBRARY_STL = "STL";
00297            static const std::string FILENAME_LIBRARY_LINUX = "Linux";
00298            static const std::string FILENAME_LIBRARY_GCC = "GCC";
00299            static const std::string FILENAME_LIBRARY_BOOST = "Boost";
00300            static const std::string FILENAME_LIBRARY_ROSE = "Rose";
00301 
00302            // CH (2/16/2010): Use this typedef to avoid following changes
00303            typedef std::string FileNameLibrary;
00304 
00305            /* This is the return type of classifyFileName, which
00306             * provides all the details it infers */
00307            class FileNameClassification
00308            {
00309            private:
00310                FileNameLocation location;
00311 
00312                // CH (2/12/2010): Change 'library' type from enum to string to let user set it
00313                FileNameLibrary library;
00314                
00315                int distance;
00316 
00317            public:
00318                FileNameClassification(FileNameLocation loc,
00319                                       const FileNameLibrary& lib,
00320                                       int dist) : location(loc),
00321                                                   library(lib),
00322                                                   distance(dist)
00323                    {}
00324                FileNameClassification() : location(FILENAME_LOCATION_UNKNOWN),
00325                                           library("Unknown"),
00326                                           distance(0)
00327                    {}
00328 
00329                /* Return the FileNameLocation which is described above
00330                 * with the definition of the enum */
00331                FileNameLocation getLocation() const
00332                    { return location; }
00333 
00334                /* Return the FileNameLibrary which is described above
00335                 * with the definition of the enum */
00336                FileNameLibrary getLibrary() const
00337                    { return library; }
00338 
00339                /* Return the "distance" of the filename from the
00340                 * appPath that was supplied during the call.  The
00341                 * distance is defined as the number of cd's that only
00342                 * move up or down one directory that it would take to
00343                 * move from the directory of the filename to the
00344                 * directory that was given by appPath.  This is
00345                 * intended as a heuristic to gage whether or not one
00346                 * believes that the filename is related to the source
00347                 * (appPath) directory.  Examples:
00348                 *
00349                 * Between /a/b/c/file.h and /a/b/d/e/ the distance is 3
00350                 * because one must cd ..; cd d; cd e; to get to appPath
00351                 *
00352                 * *EXCEPTION*: if the appPath is an ancestor of filename
00353                 * then the distance will be 0.  The idea being that this
00354                 * filename is "in" the appPath somewhere and thus part
00355                 * of the application.
00356                 */
00357                int getDistanceFromSourceDirectory() const
00358                    { return distance; }
00359 
00360                bool isUserCode() const
00361                    { return location == FILENAME_LOCATION_USER; }
00362                bool isLibraryCode() const
00363                    { return location == FILENAME_LOCATION_LIBRARY; }
00364 
00365                /* Return a string name for the library indicated by
00366                 * getLibrary() */
00367                std::string getLibraryName() const
00368                    { return library; }
00369            };
00370 
00371            /* Given a fileName and an appPath that is a path to some
00372             * application's source code directory, return a
00373             * FileNameClassification indicating whether the fileName
00374             * is part of the source code or some system library and
00375             * automatically determine the operating system from the
00376             * host uname */
00377            FileNameClassification classifyFileName(const std::string& fileName,
00378                                                    const std::string& appPath);
00379 
00380            /* Given a fileName and an appPath that is a path to some
00381             * application's source code directory, return a
00382             * FileNameClassification indicating whether the fileName
00383             * is part of the source code or some system library */
00384            FileNameClassification classifyFileName(const std::string& fileName,
00385                                                    const std::string& appPath,
00386                                                    OSType os);
00387 
00388            /* Given a fileName and an appPath that is a path to some
00389             * application's source code directory, and a collection 
00390             * of library paths, return a FileNameClassification
00391             * indicating whether the fileName is part of the source 
00392             * code or some system library and automatically determine 
00393             * the operating system from the host uname */
00394            FileNameClassification classifyFileName(const std::string& fileName,
00395                                                    const std::string& appPath,
00396                                                    const std::map<std::string, std::string>& libPathCollection);
00397 
00398            /* Given a fileName and an appPath that is a path to some
00399             * application's source code directory, and a collection 
00400             * of library paths, return a FileNameClassification
00401             * indicating whether the fileName is part of the source 
00402             * code or some system library */ 
00403            FileNameClassification classifyFileName(const std::string& fileName,
00404                                                    const std::string& appPath,
00405                                                    const std::map<std::string, std::string>& libPathCollection,
00406                                                    OSType os);
00407 
00408            /* Remove leading dots plus a space from a header file name
00409             * that is fiven in the format that g++ -H returns */
00410            const std::string
00411            stripDotsFromHeaderFileName(const std::string& name);
00412 
00413            /* Essentially the edit distance without substituion in
00414             * directory name tokens between two directories. Returns
00415             * the "distance" between left and right. The distance is
00416             * defined as the number of cd's that only move up or down
00417             * one directory that it would take to move from the
00418             * directory of the filename to the directory that was
00419             * given by appPath.  This is intended as a heuristic to
00420             * gage whether or not one believes that the left is
00421             * related to the right directory.  Examples:
00422             *
00423             * Between /a/b/c/file.h and /a/b/d/e/ the distance is 3
00424             * because one must cd ..; cd d; cd e */
00425             int directoryDistance(const std::string& left,
00426                                   const std::string& right);
00427

00430             std::string htmlEscape(const std::string& s);
